job_tasks.phrase: IBM Data & AI DevOps team is responsible for creating automated processes to develop, test, deploy, and maintain software systems across the whole software development lifecycle.
job_tasks.justification: This phrase directly describes the core responsibilities of a DevOps engineer, focusing on the automation of the software development lifecycle, including development, testing, deployment, and maintenance, which aligns with the definition of Operations & MLOps (LLMOps).

job_tasks.phrase: continuous integration and continuous deployment is critical to the success of IBM and our clients worldwide.
job_tasks.justification: This highlights the importance of CI/CD practices, a key component of DevOps and MLOps, aligning with the category's focus on deployment and maintenance pipelines.

job_tasks.phrase: As a DevOps engineer you will be responsible for design, development, maintenance and support of the IBM Knowledge Catalog services through the full systems development lifecycle on both SaaS and Hybrid Cloud platforms .
job_tasks.justification: This reiterates the responsibility for the entire systems development lifecycle, including maintenance and support, which falls under the Operations & MLOps (LLMOps) category.

job_tasks.phrase: adhering to industry best practices for quality, performance, scalability, resiliency and security.
job_tasks.justification: These are all key operational concerns for maintaining robust software systems, aligning with the definition of Operations & MLOps (LLMOps).

job_tasks.phrase: You will work in a Kubernetes based micro services environment to support our bleeding edge cloud services.
job_tasks.justification: Working with Kubernetes and microservices for cloud services is a core aspect of modern DevOps and MLOps infrastructure management.

job_tasks.phrase: This will include custom solutions, as well as open source DevOps tools (build and deploy automation, monitoring and data gathering for our software delivery pipeline).
job_tasks.justification: This explicitly mentions build and deploy automation, monitoring, and data gathering for the software delivery pipeline, which are all central to the Operations & MLOps (LLMOps) category.

job_tasks.phrase: You will also be contributing to our continuous improvement and continuous delivery while increasing maturity of DevOps and agile adoption practices.
job_tasks.justification: This phrase directly addresses continuous improvement, continuous delivery, and the maturity of DevOps practices, fitting perfectly into the Operations & MLOps (LLMOps) category.

job_tasks.phrase: At IBM, you will use the latest software development tools, techniques and approaches and work with leading minds in the industry to build solutions you can be proud of.
job_tasks.justification: This general statement about using software development tools and techniques to build solutions aligns with the broader Software Development & Integration category.

soft_skills.phrase: You are curious to learn as demonstrated by your up-to-date technical knowledge and demonstrated ongoing learning.
You are a good team player, self-directed, with working knowledge of Agile methodologies and principles.
We seek an applicant who will thrive in an open, dynamic, flexible, fun, spirited, collaborative environment;
an individual who desires creative freedom and the opportunity to work in a high performing team.
You will contribute to a thriving and growing DevOps Engineering team.

profile.rationale: The job advertisement focuses exclusively on DevOps responsibilities, including CI/CD, automation, deployment, maintenance, and working with Kubernetes and microservices. There are no mentions of AI/ML model development, fine-tuning, prompt engineering, RAG, or specific AI/ML technologies. The tasks described fall entirely within Macro-Category A (Core Software Engineering), specifically under Operations & MLOps (LLMOps) and Software Development & Integration. Therefore, the most appropriate profile is 'Software Engineer'.

confidence.reasoning: The job ad is very clear and specific about the responsibilities of a DevOps engineer. It explicitly details tasks related to automation, deployment, maintenance, and infrastructure management within a Kubernetes environment. There is no ambiguity or mention of AI/ML specific tasks, making the classification straightforward.
